definition: train attendant
to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
surname Che
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)
person/employee/member

sentences.english: The staff are getting the public carriages ready for a knees-up later in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 列車員們在整理公共車廂，準備晚上的慶典。

sentences.english: Soon after the train was underway, the conductor walked through the car, checking tickets.
sentences.chinese: 火車開動後不久，列車員就到車廂裏來檢票了。

sentences.english: No problem, the conductress will show you.
sentences.chinese: 沒問題，這女列車員會告訴您的。

sentences.english: To recognise my direction, her signing pen gives a line on my ticket.
sentences.chinese: 列車員用簽字筆，在車票正面劃了一道。

sentences.english: An arm stretches out from the bathroom and the conductor takes the proffered ticket.
sentences.chinese: 一隻拿着票的手從裏面伸出來，列車員拿着票離開了。

sentences.english: There were the smartly uniformed provodnitsas (train attendants) standing territorially by their carriage doors while they scrutinised tickets.
sentences.chinese: 穿着漂亮制服的列車員站在自己車廂門前檢票。

sentences.english: Because I thought you were the trainman, and Ihaven't even got a ticket.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我以爲你是列車員，而我沒有買車票。

sentences.english: Conclusion The railway train waiters fatigue is obv…
sentences.chinese: 結論鐵路列車員疲勞狀況明顯。

sentences.english: You can hide under my seat when the conductor comes to check the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 當列車員來查票時，你可以藏在我的坐位下面。

sentences.english: After my wife presented her ticket, the conductor asked for the rabbits' tickets.
sentences.chinese: 我太太出示了車票，列車員又向她索要兔子的車票。

sentences.english: When the conductor came to check the tickets.
sentences.chinese: 當這個列車員來查票時你可以躲藏在我的座位下面。

sentences.english: Our attendant came round to lock all the windows against dust.
sentences.chinese: 列車員關上了所有車窗防止塵土侵入車廂。

sentences.english: He ran up to the conductor and began to shout at him.
sentences.chinese: 他跑到列車員那兒，衝他大叫大嚷起來。

definition: (railway) carriage
kindergarten bus/baby carriage/stroller
(airport) check-in/boarding formalities
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
examination room (in a doctor's office)
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
psychiatric hospital
to make a bed/to lay bedding
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
(idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
summer sleeping mat (e.g. of woven split bamboo)/CL:張|张[zhang1],領|领[ling3]
to whisper to one another's ear
